Option.name: secure
Option.help-text: --secure | -s - indicate that communication to the admin server should be encrypted (defaults to no encryption)

Option.name: interactive
Option.help-text: --interactive|-I - mode in which the program runs

Option.name: echo
Option.help-text: --echo|-e - for displaying the command on the console

Option.name: printprompt
Option.help-text: --printprompt|-P - for printing the prompt on the console

Option.name: help
Option.help-text: --help|h - Displays the help information for a command

Option.name: host
Option.help-text: --host|-o - hostname or IP address of target administration server

Option.name: port
Option.help-text: --port|-p - port number of the administration server

Option.name: user
Option.help-text: --user|-u - user name with which the client wants to authenticate

Option.name: password
Option.help-text: --password|-w - password associated with user

Option.name: domain
Option.help-text: --domain - domain name of the appserver

Option.name: adminport
Option.help-text: --adminport - port number of the administration server

Option.name: adminuser
Option.help-text: --adminuser - user name with which the client wants to authenticate to administration server

Option.name: adminpassword
Option.help-text: --adminpassword - password associated with adminuser

Option.name: adminserv
Option.help-text: --adminserv|--no-adminserv -determine whether to stop domain with or without adminserver

Option.name: sysuser
Option.help-text: --sysuser - valid OS user on the system

Option.name: path
Option.help-text: --path - domain path

Option.name: instance
Option.help-text: --instance|-i - instance name of the application server

Option.name: reconfig
Option.help-text: --reconfig|-r - allows the server instance to re-read the config files implicitly

Option.name: prefix
Option.help-text: --user|-u - user name with which the client wants to authenticate

Option.name: file
Option.help-text: --file|-f - the file from which the input is read from

Option.name: instanceport
Option.help-text: --instanceport - port of the instance to be created

Option.name: type
Option.help-text: --type - type of the deployable component (application|ejb|web|connector) or type of the element that ssl element exists in (http-listener, iiop-listener, iiop-service)

Option.name: datasource
Option.help-text: --datasource - datasource to be hooked up with a database

Option.name: monitor
Option.help-text: --monitor|m - setting monitor to true will get the monitorable attributes on the server, if set to false the get command will return the configurable attribute names from the server

Option.name: appname
Option.help-text: --appname - application name in which ejbs and servlets to be listed

Option.name: force
Option.help-text: --force - force deployement (redeploy)

Option.name: virtualservers
Option.help-text: --virtualservers - associate deployed component to the comma seperated list of virtual_servers

Option.name: precompilejsp
Option.help-text: --precompilejsp - precompile JSP's

Option.name: upload
Option.help-text: --upload - upload will allow the CLI client to upload the deployable file to the admin server machine

Option.name: name
Option.help-text: --name - deployable component name

Option.name: contextroot
Option.help-text: --contextroot - context root of the web component

Option.name: jndilookupname
Option.help-text: --jndilookupname - JNDI lookup name

Option.name: desttype
Option.help-text: --desttype|-t - JMS destination type

Option.name: mime
Option.help-text: --mime - mime types file

Option.name: hosts
Option.help-text: --hosts - comma seperated list of hosts

Option.name: datasourceclassname
Option.help-text: --datasourceclassname - class name of the data source

Option.name: connectionpoolid
Option.help-text: --connectionpoolid - connection pool id of the resource

Option.name: property
Option.help-text: --property - property attribute (name/value pair)

Option.name: description
Option.help-text: --description - description of this configuration

Option.name: resourcetype
Option.help-text: --resourcetype - type of the resource

Option.name: jdbcjndiname
Option.help-text: --jdbcjndiname - jdbc resource jndi name

Option.name: restype
Option.help-text: --restype - This optional attribute must be specified to disambiguate when a Datasource class implements both interfaces (javax.sql.DataSource, javax.sql.XADataSource).

Option.name: steadypoolsize
Option.help-text: --steadypoolsize - minimum number of threads listening for incoming requests. default is 10

Option.name: maxpoolsize
Option.help-text: --maxpoolsize - maximum number of connections that can be created by client requests. default is 32

Option.name: maxwait
Option.help-text: --maxwait - maximum time in millisecond for the client to wait before timeout. default is 60sec

Option.name: poolresize
Option.help-text: --poolresize - number of connections to be created if a request arrives when pool is completely busy. default is 2

Option.name: idletimeout
Option.help-text: --idletimeout - maximum time in seconds for a connection to remain idle in the pool. default is 300

Option.name: isolationlevel
Option.help-text: --isolationlevel - Specifies the Transaction Isolation Level on the pooled database connections.

Option.name: isisolationguaranteed
Option.help-text: --isisolationguaranteed - Applicable only when a particular isolation level is specified for transaction-isolation-level.

Option.name: isconnectvalidatereq
Option.help-text: --isconnectvalidatereq - true or false. If true, then connection will be validated. default is false

Option.name: validationmethod
Option.help-text: --validationmethod - type of validation to perform if isconnectvalidatereq is true (auto-commit|meta-data|table) default is auto-commit

Option.name: validationtable
Option.help-text: --validationtable - specifies the table name to be used to perform a query to validate a connection. This parameter is mandatory, if connection-validation-type set to table.

Option.name: failconnection
Option.help-text: --failconnection - true or false. indicates if all connections in pool need to be closed if one validation fails. default is false

Option.name: storeprotocol
Option.help-text: --storeprotocol - mail store protocol. default to imap

Option.name: storeprotocolclass
Option.help-text: --storeprotocolclass - mail store protocol class. default to com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore

Option.name: transprotocol
Option.help-text: --transprotocol - mail transport protocol. default to smtp

Option.name: transprotocolclass
Option.help-text: --transprotocolclass - mail transport protocol class. default to com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport

Option.name: debug
Option.help-text: --debug - debug mode, default is false

Option.name: factoryclass
Option.help-text: --factoryclass - factory class name of the resource

Option.name: mailhost
Option.help-text: --mailhost - host name of the mail server

Option.name: mailuser
Option.help-text: --mailuser - user name

Option.name: fromaddress
Option.help-text: --fromaddress - from address

Option.name: listeneraddress
Option.help-text: --listeneraddress - address of IIOP listener

Option.name: classname
Option.help-text: --classname - class name

Option.name: address
Option.help-text: --address - address

Option.name: listenerport
Option.help-text: --listenerport - port of the listener

Option.name: servername
Option.help-text: --servername - name of the server

Option.name: defaultvs
Option.help-text: --defaultvs - default virtual server

Option.name: mimefile
Option.help-text: --mimefile - mime file

Option.name: aclfile
Option.help-text: --aclfile - acl file

Option.name: virtualserver
Option.help-text: --virtualserver - virtual server id

Option.name: database
Option.help-text: --database - acl file

Option.name: httplistenerid
Option.help-text: --httplistenerid - HTTP-Listener ID

Option.name: iioplistenerid
Option.help-text: --iioplistenerid - IIOP-Listener ID

Option.name: basedn
Option.help-text: --basedn - Overrides the base DN lookup in the dbswitch.conf file

Option.name: certmaps
Option.help-text: --certmaps - certificate to LDAP entry mappings (defined in certmap.conf) to use

Option.name: family
Option.help-text: --family - The socket family type

Option.name: acceptorthreads
Option.help-text: --acceptorthreads - Number of acceptor threads for the listen socket

Option.name: blockingenabled
Option.help-text: --blockingenabled - Determines whether the http listener socket and the accepted socket are put in to blocking mode

Option.name: securityenabled
Option.help-text: --securityenabled - Determines whether the http listener runs SSL

Option.name: enabled
Option.help-text: --enabled - specified if the component is enabled

Option.name: bwlimit
Option.help-text: --bwlimit - maximum bandwidth limit for the Virtual Server Class or Virtual Server, in bytes per second

Option.name: enforcebwlimit
Option.help-text: --enforcebwlimit - whether the bandwidth limit should be enforced or not

Option.name: connlimit
Option.help-text: --connlimit - maximum number of concurrent connections for the server, virtual-server-class, or virtual-server

Option.name: enforceconnlimit
Option.help-text: --enforceconnlimit - whether the connection limit should be enforced or not

Option.name: iiopport
Option.help-text: --iiopport - port number of the IIOP listener

Option.name: encoding
Option.help-text: --encoding - character encoding

Option.name: classpath
Option.help-text: --classpath - where this module is actually located, if it is not under applications-root

Option.name: loadorder
Option.help-text: --loadorder - integer value that can be used to force the order in which deployed lifecycle modules are loaded at server start up

Option.name: failurefatal
Option.help-text: --failurefatal - if true, aborts server start up if this module does not load properly

Option.name: nativelibpath
Option.help-text: --nativelibpath - path to the native libraries

Option.name: certname
Option.help-text: --certname - nickname of the server certificate in the certificate database or the PKCS#11 token

Option.name: ssl2enabled
Option.help-text: --ssl2enabled - Determines whether SSL2 is enabled

Option.name: ssl2ciphers
Option.help-text: --ssl2ciphers - A comma-separated list of the SSL2 ciphers used, with the prefix + to enable or - to disable

Option.name: ssl3enabled
Option.help-text: --ssl3enabled - Determines whether SSL3 is enabled

Option.name: ssl3tlsciphers
Option.help-text: --ssl3ciphers - A comma-separated list of the SSL3 ciphers used, with the prefix + to enable or - to disable

Option.name: tlsenabled
Option.help-text: --tlsenabled - Determines whether TLS is enabled

Option.name: tlsrollbackenabled
Option.help-text: --tlsrollbackenabled - Determines whether TLS rollback is enabled

Option.name: clientauthenabled
Option.help-text: --clientauthenabled - Determines whether SSL3 client authentication is performed on every request, independent of ACL-based access control

Option.name: httplisteners
Option.help-text: --httplisteners - A comma-separated list of http-listener id(s), Required only for a Virtual Server that is not the default virtual server

Option.name: defaultwebmodule
Option.help-text: --defaultwebmodule - stand alone web module associated with this virtual server by default

Option.name: configfile
Option.help-text: --configfile - Typically all virtual server initialization is from $INSTANCE_ROOT/config/obj.conf. This can be changed using this attribute

Option.name: defaultobj
Option.help-text: --defaultobj - names the object loaded from an obj.conf file which is the default

Option.name: state
Option.help-text: --state - Determines whether a Virtual Server is active(on) or inactive (off, disable)

Option.name: acls
Option.help-text: --acls - One or more id attributes of acl elements, separated by commas

Option.name: logfile
Option.help-text: --logfile - Specifies a log file for virtual-server-specific log messages. If this is not specified, log messages go to $LOG_ROOT/server.log

Option.name: acceptlang
Option.help-text: --acceptlang - If on, the server parses the Accept-Language header and sends an appropriate language version based on which language the client can accept

Option.name: discardmanualchanges
Option.help-text: --discardmanualchanges - discard manual changes to the confi files

Option.name: keepmanualchanges
Option.help-text: --keepmanualchanges - keep manual changes to the config files

Option.name: retrieve
Option.help-text: --retrieve - local directory path to retrieve the file

Option.name: local
Option.help-text: --local|l - run the command locally

Option.name: verbose
Option.help-text: --verbose|v - display info in verbose

Option.name: profiler
Option.help-text: --profiler|F - use with jvm-options command

Option.name: userpassword
Option.help-text: --userpassword - user password associated with creating user in keyfile

Option.name: groups
Option.help-text: --groups - user groups associated with creating user in keyfile

Option.name: verify
Option.help-text: --verify|V - verifies the S1AS specific descriptors of archive files

Option.name: passwordfile
Option.help-text: --passwordfile - the file from which the passwords are read

Option.name: aorestype
Option.help-text: --aorestype - Admin object resource type

Option.name: raname
Option.help-text: --raname - resource adapter name

Option.name: connectiondefinition
Option.help-text: --connectiondefinition - connection definition name

Option.name: poolname
Option.help-text: --poolname - connection pool name

Option.name: domaindir
Option.help-text: --domaindir - Directory containing all domains

Option.name: domainproperties
Option.help-text: --domainproperties - domain property attributes (name/value pairs)

Option.name: dbvendorname
Option.help-text: --dbvendorname - generate DDL files for a specific database vendor name

Option.name: createtables
Option.help-text: --createtables - create the tables

Option.name: dropandcreatetables
Option.help-text: --dropandcreatetables - drops and creates the tables

Option.name: uniquetablenames
Option.help-text: --uniquetablenames - Unique Table Names

Option.name: droptables
Option.help-text: --droptables - Drop tables

ValidCommand.name: setlocalenv
ValidCommand.help-text: setlocalenv - sets the options in the environment

ValidCommand.name: export
ValidCommand.help-text: export - exports the CLI environment options

ValidCommand.name: unset
ValidCommand.help-text: unset - unset the CLI environment options

ValidCommand.name: create-domain
ValidCommand.help-text: create-domain - creates a domain with the given name
ValidCommand.usage-text: create-domain [--path domain_path] [--passwordfile file_name] --adminport port_number [--instanceport instanceport] --adminuser admin --adminpassword password [--domainproperties (name=value)[:name=value]*] domain_name

ValidCommand.name: stop-domain
ValidCommand.usage-text: stop-domain [--user admin_user] [--password admin_password] [--host localhost] [--port 4848] [--local=false] [--domain domain_name] [--passwordfile file_name] [--secure | -s] [--domaindir domain_dir]

ValidCommands.ValidCommand: show-instance-status 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ShowInstanceStatusCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS;
show-component-status 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ShowComponentStatusCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance type
get + com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.GetAttributeCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; monitor
list 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListAttributeCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; monitor
set + com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.SetAttributeCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; monitor

reconfig ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ReconfigCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; discardmanualchanges keepmanualchanges reconfig - Allows the server to re-read the config files reconfig &STANDARD_HELP; [--discardmanualchanges=false|--keepmanualchanges=false] [instancename]

list-components ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListComponentsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; type list-components - Lists the deployed components in an instance list-components &STANDARD_HELP; [--type application|ejb|web|connector] [instancename]
list-sub-components 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListSubComponentsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance type appname

deploy 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeployCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance force precompilejsp verify upload name type contextroot retrieve virtualservers dbvendorname createtables dropandcreatetables uniquetablenames deploy - Deploys a deployable component to the instance deploy &STANDARD_HELP; [--virtualservers virtual_servers] [--type application|ejb|web|connector] [--contextroot contextroot] [--force=true] [--precompilejsp=false] [--verify=false] [--name component-name] [--upload=true] [--retrieve local_dirpath] [--dbvendorname dbvendorname] [--createtables=true|false | --dropandcreatetables=true|false] [--uniquetablenames=true|false] filepath

undeploy 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.UndeployCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance type droptables undeploy - Undeploys a deployable component from the instance undeploy &STANDARD_HELP; [--type application|ejb|web|connector] [--droptables=true|false] component-name
deploydir 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeployCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance force precompilejsp verify name type contextroot virtualservers

get-client-stubs 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.GetClientStubsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; type instance name get-client-stubs - Retrieves the client stubs jar from the server. get-client-stubs &STANDARD_HELP; --name application-name [--type application|ejb] local-directory-path
enable 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.EnableCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance type
disable 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DisableCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance type
shutdown 0 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ShutdownCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS;

delete-jvm-options 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeleteJVMOptionsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance profiler

create-file-user 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.CreateFileUserCommand instance userpassword groups &STANDARD_OPTIONS; create-file-user - Creates a user along with the password and group in the specified instance keyfile create-file-user &STANDARD_HELP; [--userpassword user_password] [--groups user_groups[:user_groups]*] username

delete-file-user 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeleteFileUserCommand instance &STANDARD_OPTIONS; delete-file-user - Deletes a user from the specified instance keyfile delete-file-user &STANDARD_HELP; username

update-file-user 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.UpdateFileUserCommand instance userpassword groups &STANDARD_OPTIONS; update-file-user - Updates a user along with the password and group in the specified instance keyfile update-file-user &STANDARD_HELP; [--userpassword user_password] [--groups user_groups[:user_groups]*] username
list-file-users ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListFileUsersCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; list-file-users - List file users list-file-users &STANDARD_HELP; [instance_name]
list-file-groups ? name com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListFileGroupsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; list-file-groups - List file groups list-file-groups &STANDARD_HELP; [--name username] [instance_name]

add-admin-object 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.AddAdminObjectCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance raname aorestype property add-admin-object - Creates the Admin Object add-admin-object &STANDARD_HELP; --aorestype aorestype [--property (name=value)[:name=value]*] --raname raname jndiname
delete-admin-object 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeleteAdminObjectCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance delete-admin-object - Deletes the Admin Object delete-admin-object &STANDARD_HELP; jndiname

list-admin-objects ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListAdminObjectCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; list-admin-objects - Lists the jndi names of the Admin Objects list-admin-objects &STANDARD_HELP; [instance_name]

create-connector-connection-pool 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.CreateConnectorConnectionPoolCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance raname connectiondefinition steadypoolsize maxpoolsize maxwait poolresize idletimeout failconnection property create-connector-connection-pool - Creates a connector connection pool create-connector-connection-pool &STANDARD_HELP; [--steadypoolsize 8] [--maxpoolsize 32] [--maxwait 60000] [--poolresize 2] [--idletimeout 300] [--failconnection=false] --raname resourceAdapterName --connectiondefinition connectionDefinitionName [--property (name=value)[:name=value]*] poolname

delete-connector-connection-pool 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeleteConnectorConnectionPoolCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance delete-connector-connection-pool - Deletes the connector connection pool delete-connector-connection-pool &STANDARD_HELP; poolname

list-connector-connection-pools ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListConnectorConnectionPoolsCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; list-connector-connection-pools - Lists the names of all the connector connection pools list-connector-connection-pools &STANDARD_HELP; [instance_name]

create-connector-resource 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.CreateConnectorResourceCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance poolname enabled description property create-connector-resource - Creates a connector resource create-connector-resource &STANDARD_HELP; --poolname connectorConnectionPoolName [--description description] jndiName

delete-connector-resource 1 com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.DeleteConnectorResourceCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; instance delete-connector-resource - Deletes the connector resource delete-connector-resource &STANDARD_HELP; jndiName

list-connector-resources ? com.sun.enterprise.tools.cli.ListConnectorResourcesCommand &STANDARD_OPTIONS; list-connector-resources - Lists the names of all the connector resources list-connector-resources &STANDARD_HELP; [instance_name]
